meanings.definition: To import or export secretly, in violation of the law
meanings.sent1: The thief smuggled the stolen goods across the border.
meanings.sent2: The criminals smuggled contraband through the underground tunnels.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon smuggled the cookies from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She smuggled her emotions deep within her heart, hiding them from the world.
meanings.sent5: The spy carefully smuggled the classified documents out of the building.

meanings.definition: To bring in or take out illicitly or by stealth
meanings.sent1: The students smuggled snacks into the movie theater.
meanings.sent2: The pirates smuggled treasures from the sunken ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat smuggled a toy mouse into its bed.
meanings.sent4: He smuggled memories of her smile into every corner of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician skillfully smuggled the rabbit out of the hat.

meanings.sent1: The spy smuggled the secret message in a hollowed-out book.
meanings.sent2: The undercover agent smuggled valuable information to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel smuggled acorns into the bird's nest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter smuggled joy into the room, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully smuggled hidden meanings into his paintings.
